description: Applecart Arts is a grade II listed library building, built by the philanthropist Passmore Edwards and designed by the renowned architect, Silvanus Trevail. The library was opened in 1899. For a period of time, the building was used as a registry office before sitting dormant. In 2021, the arts charity began an extensive refurbishment, opening the site to the public as a creative arts hub.

events.name: Drop in: Walking tour of the building
events.notes: Walking tour of the building, including areas not usually open to the public.  Tours take place hourly on the hour between 12.00 and 17.00.

factsheet.heading: Applecart Arts Today
paragraphs:
In 2021 Applecart Arts took over the building, saving it from closure and demolition, now hosting a wide range of artistic disciplines.
We work with a wide range of artistic disciplines â€“ creating original music, film, visual art and drama. We combine this with our long-standing commitment to community engagement and pursuit of artistic excellence.
We aim to reach across cultural divides and tell stories which engage, inspire and entertain our audiences.

name: Applecart Arts
